text: Is there any way in the _page editor_ to add a _row?_ If I pull in a module it just puts it directly in the column, it doesn't create a row around it. I can't add padding on custom modules though so I need a row to do that.
Can you clone the row, then replace the module contents in the clone?
No, it won't even let me move modules into the rows already there. I've even tried in the default HubSpot theme on different portals and same problem.
_Sometimes_ I can manage to drag module into the row but it's super finicky.
There isn’t currently way to manually create an empty row, your best bet is to drag a new module to the left or right of an existing one to “split” the module.
<https://p191.p3.n0.cdn.getcloudapp.com/items/9Zu8YGrv/a7a475dd-d649-400f-9047-1dedf6d40dfc.gif?v=23254e764c382410aa90c8c3be159308>
The targeting “laser beams” will become the size of the module your splitting, as opposed to the size of the column
And it’s all percentage based, I’d have to look up the exact code but the tldr; there is the bigger the module it is the easier it would be to hit the sweet spot
So I can't create a row for just a single module?

No way to do it manually ATM, but we’ve been looking into adding features that let you scaffold out an empty layout and _then_ add content to it as opposed to generating the layout in response to adding content.

And we have some code in the editor that will auto delete unneeded layout fragments, so like, if you created that row with 2 modules, then deleted one of them, we _generally_ remove row and just put the one remaining module into the parent column

_However_, we _dont_ don’t remove a row like that if the row has styling on it. So the work around here would probably be, split a module into a row, add _any_ sort of styling to that row, then delete the module you had just added
It’d be amazing to have a feature that let’s us scaffold out structure, right click and wrap in a row
Yeah we’ve kicked around that idea abunch internally. Mostly a matter of priorities and finding a way to do it in a way that doesn’t make the UI busier than it already is.

Is there any plan to add padding options to Custom Modules? My use case here is that the user will be adding multiple different custom modules in a single column and would need to add padding between each. The empty layout option wouldn't work here cause I wouldn't know exactly how many modules the user would plan on adding.
that is on their roadmap… (announced at dev day). But you can just add your own padding fields and markup to your modules.
Yea, that's what I've done before. It just doesn't look as nice UI wise as compared to the padding UI for rows/columns. :sweat_smile:
:awthanks: Glad you like the padding UI there :stuck_out_tongue:
<@U39DT5YFL> I completely agree!
Hi BJ - any update? We would need that to be able to define custom stacking on mobile.

As far as I know it has still not been introduced. However, you can simulate custom stacking on mobile by making use of the theme’s breakpoints setting and toggling on and off various modules on desktop vs mobile. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/responsive-breakpoints>
